description:
Cooper Hurley Injury Lawyers is a personal injury and wrongful death only law firm with a main office in downtown Norfolk, Virginia, and client meeting locations in all Hampton Roads cities as well as on the Eastern Shore of Virginia.Our Norfolk office is at 125 St Pauls Blvd, facing the Norfolk Circuit Court.

John Cooper and Jim Hurley set up Cooper Hurley Injury Lawyers in 2011. In recent years the firm appointed a third partner Bill O’Mara and fourth partner Griff O'Hanlon. Cooper Hurley Injury Lawyers was set up with the goal of protecting the rights of people injured in auto wrecks and other accidents and the families of those killed due to the fault of another in Hampton Roads, the rest of Virginia and north eastern North Carolina. Although all cases are different and we cannot guarantee the same result in your case, we have recovered millions of dollars in verdicts and settlements for our clients, and have handled virtually all types of personal injury and accident-related cases.

You can turn to our law firm for help after any of the following:

• Motor vehicle accidents
• Trucking accidents
• Motorcycle accidents
• Brain and spinal cord injuries
• Railroad accidents
• Injuries at a business such as a store, a hotel or a restaurant
• Wrongful death of a family member

Our attorneys are consistently recognized for their excellence in personal injury law. Both our founders, John Cooper and Jim Hurley, are peer-rated AV Preeminent* by Martindale-Hubbell and have been selected for inclusion in Virginia Super Lawyers. Attorneys Bill O'Mara and John Baker were selected by Super Lawyers to be a Rising Stars. This accolade is reserved for fewer than 2.5 percent of lawyers in Virginia. Attorney Griffin O'Hanlon joined the firm in 2015 John Baker and Paige Thomas joined in 2018.

If you or someone you love suffers an injury due to the fault of a driver, a trucking company, a business or a manufacturer, or a medical professional, you can turn to Cooper Hurley Injury Lawyers for experienced legal representation you can depend on. Find out more about how we can help by scheduling a free initial consultation. Call 757-905-4240.

*AV Preeminent and BV Distinguished are certification marks of Reed Elsevier Properties Inc., used in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the confidential opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell ratings fall into two categories: legal ability and general ethical standards.
